result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac R Hoel

records.addlTxt:
Judge John Manydeeds for Branch 1 intake. 
(Cases 22CM552, 22CM564 are are called at 9:54 AM) Defendant Isaac R Hoel in court.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Isaac R Hoel.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement- recites the joint sentence recommendation. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CM564 Count 1- Disorderly Conduct. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including all of 22CM552. Defendant makes a sentence. 
Court orders the Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, and court costs.

9:40 am case called. Defendant Isaac R Hoel not in court.  Attorney Rachel Allison Robole in court for Isaac R Hoel.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:31 AM cases 22CM564, 22CM552 called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaac R Hoel in court with Attorney Rachel Allison Robole. Attorney Robole states and offer has been received but time is needed to go over with Defendant. New date is requested.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

Defendant updates address with the Court.
